You are working on wp-migrate.sh, a WordPress migration bash script that pushes wp-content and database exports from source to destination servers.

CRITICAL WORKFLOW ENFORCEMENT:
Before ANY git operation (branch, commit, push, PR), you MUST:
1. Ask the user: 'Are you working on v1.x.x maintenance (main) or v2.0.0 development (v2)?'
2. Read and reference the appropriate workflow (workflow_v1 or workflow_v2) from this settings file
3. State which workflow step you're executing (e.g., 'V1 Step 7: Pushing feature branch to main')
4. Verify branch naming matches target (v2-* branches MUST target v2, others target main)
5. Check the project follows ShellCheck standards (script is currently ShellCheck-clean)

If you cannot confirm all 5 items above, STOP and ask the user for clarification.

IMPORTANT: Before starting ANY work, ALWAYS:
- Ask which version (v1 or v2) the user wants to work on
- Read project documentation (README.md, CHANGELOG.md)
- Understand the full scope before making changes
- Follow the correct workflow for the target version

Key Requirements:
- v1 work: branch from main ‚Üí PR to main (production stable)
- v2 work: branch from v2 ‚Üí PR to v2 (major refactor, NOT ready for production)
- NEVER merge v2-* branches directly to main
- NEVER push directly to main or v2 - ALL merges via GitHub PRs
- Update CHANGELOG.md in [Unreleased] section for ALL changes (both v1 and v2)
- Maintain ShellCheck-clean code
- Use conventional commit messages (feat:, fix:, test:, docs:, chore:, refactor:)

workflow_v1.description: For v1.x.x maintenance - bug fixes and minor features
steps: 1. git checkout main && git pull --rebase origin main
2. git checkout -b <type>/<descriptive-slug>  (e.g., fix/url-validation)
3. Make changes and test with --dry-run
4. Run shellcheck wp-migrate.sh
5. Update CHANGELOG.md [Unreleased] section
6. git add -A && git commit -m 'type: description'
7. git push origin <branch-name>
8. Open PR to main (TARGET: main, NOT v2)
9. After merge, delete feature branch locally and remotely
10. User decides if release is needed (you ask, don't assume)
examples: fix/maintenance-mode-cleanup ‚Üí PR to main ‚Üí v1.1.9 release
feature/add-retry-logic ‚Üí PR to main ‚Üí v1.2.0 release

workflow_v2.description: For v2.0.0 development - major refactor and new architecture
steps: 1. git checkout v2 && git pull --rebase origin v2
2. git checkout -b v2-<type>/<descriptive-slug>  (e.g., v2-feature/modularize)
3. Make changes and test with --dry-run (if applicable)
4. Run shellcheck on affected files
5. Update CHANGELOG.md [Unreleased] section (note it's for v2)
6. git add -A && git commit -m 'type: description'
7. git push origin <branch-name>
8. Open PR to v2 branch (TARGET: v2, NOT main) ‚ö†Ô∏è
9. After merge, delete feature branch locally and remotely
10. NO releases until v2 branch is complete and merged to main
workflow_v2.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è NEVER create PR from v2-* branches to main. Always target v2 branch.

multiPrStrategy.note: When creating multiple independent PRs simultaneously:
multiPrStrategy.v1_strategy: Create all from main, but rebase each remaining PR after every merge to main
multiPrStrategy.v2_strategy: Create all from v2, but rebase each remaining PR after every merge to v2
multiPrStrategy.cross_version: Keep v1 and v2 PRs completely separate. Do NOT merge v2 work into v1.
